Package edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.graph

Class StateNode

java.lang.Object
edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.graph.StateNode
All Implemented Interfaces:
FiniteState, State, Unique, Serializable
public class StateNode extends Object implements Serializable, Unique, FiniteState
A state node represents an assignment of a value to every fluent tracked by a state graph as well as the beliefs of every character tracked by the graph. Permanent (that is, non-temporary) nodes are unique, meaning there are no other state nodes in the same graph which represent exactly the same state. Note that a state is not defined only by the values assigned to fluents but also includes all beliefs about fluents, beliefs about beliefs, and so on. This means that a state is actually defined by a node and all nodes which can be reached via epistemic edges from this node.
Author:
Stephen G. Ware

    • getTemporalChildren

      public EdgeIterable<TemporalEdge> getTemporalChildren()
      Returns a collection of all temporal edges in the graph that have this node as their parent.
      Returns:
      a collection of temporal nodes with this node as parent

    • getTemporalChild

      public TemporalEdge getTemporalChild(Event event)
      Returns a temporal edge that has this node as its parent and a given event as its label, if one exists in the graph. The child of the edge will be the state of the world after taking the given event in the state represented by this node. If the edge could exist but does not, this method will not create it. See after(Action).
      Parameters:
      event - an event which can occur in this state
      Returns:
      the temporal edge with this node as its parent, the given event as its label, and the state after this event as its child, or null if no such edge has been created yet

    • getTemporalParents

      public EdgeIterable<TemporalEdge> getTemporalParents()
      Returns a collection of all temporal edges that have this node as the child in the graph. If edges could exist but do not, this method will not create them.
      Returns:
      all temporal edges with this node as the child

    • getEpistemicChildren

      public EdgeIterable<EpistemicEdge> getEpistemicChildren()
      Returns a collection of all epistemic edges that have this node as the parent in the graph. There will always be exactly as many edges as there are characters tracked by the graph. These edges represent the state of the world these characters believe to be that case when the actual state is this node.
      Returns:
      all epistemic edges with this node as the parent

    • getEpistemicChild

      public EpistemicEdge getEpistemicChild(Character character)
      Returns the epistemic edge that has this node as the parent and a given character as the label. The child of the edge will be the state the character believes the world to be in when the world is actually in the state represented by this node. The edge will always exist, unless the character is not one of the characters tracked by the graph.
      Parameters:
      character - the character whose beliefs are desired
      Returns:
      an edge with this node as the parent, the given character as the label, and the character's beliefs as the child

    • getEpistemicParents

      public EdgeIterable<EpistemicEdge> getEpistemicParents()
      Returns a collection of all epistemic edges that have this node as the child in the graph.
      Returns:
      all epistemic edges with this node as the child

    • after

      public StateNode after(Action action)
      Returns the state that would result from applying the effects of the given action to this state. In other words, this action finds a temporal edge with this node as the parent, the given action as the label, and returns the edge's child. If the edge does not already exist, it will be created. This method does not check whether the precondition of the action is satisfied in this state; it simply applies effect of the action.
      Parameters:
      action - the action whose effect will modify this state
      Returns:
      the state after applying the action's effect

    • afterTriggers

      public StateNode afterTriggers()
      Returns the state after applying all triggers tracked by the graph to this state. Specifically, this method finds a trigger whose precondition is satisfied in this state (or any epistemically accessible state), applies its effect, and then recursively does the same thing in the resulting state, stopping when no more triggers can occur. This method should generally be called after after(Action) to find the state of the world after taking an action.
      Returns:
      the state after applying all relevant triggers
